column4: sudoers file: syntax error, line 25 <<< sudo: parse error in /etc/sudoers near line 25
I am getting Parse error in /etc/sudoers  file as i added a statement in it
!pastebin the content please, you probably have a typo somewhere.
sudo visudo       then select, copy and paste.
using sudo visudo , i am getting the same parse error
how did you exactly edit it then?
please read carefully what i write. I need to see the content of the file /etc/sudoers. That line is not correct and has to be deleted. How did you add this line? Which command did you use?
Can you tell me how to remove this extra line from sudoers file . I simply used sudo /etc/sudoers to edit it and add that extra line.
sudo /etc/sudoers is not a command to edit the file. Please tell me the command you used to edit the file.
execute that command and remove the last line, then save it.
Thats what i am not able to do. I am getting parse error every time i try to run the command
sudo cat /etc/sudoers > ~/sudoers              this should create a copy in your home directory. Can you pastebin the file sudoers from your home directory?
make a pastebin from the terminal, including the command and the error.

you will have to boot into recovery mode, then edit the sudoers file by removing the last line (the one with postgresql). You cannot do this from your running system as sudo cannot be used. Do not use nano or any other default text editor to edit the sudoers file, use visudo for this.
